document.title: English Standards of Learning for Virginia Public Schools March 2024

845545DC0E33421EA3BC984E1A644A46.description:
Avoid plagiarism and give proper credit by providing citations whenever using another
person’s media, facts, ideas, graphics, music, and direct quotations.

7AAEC057B4254114B80F31499705C8BB.description: Organize and share information orally, in writing, or through visual display.

925B7991572D43BCB638A1C0448FD7C9.description:
Develop notes that include important concept, summaries, and identification of information
sources.

A32AEDFD082D4ABE9063974400F7BB2D.description:
Organize and synthesize information from the print and digital resources determining the
relevance and reliability of the information gathered.

991D15CF3E854695BEA539F4893E7089.description:
Identify search terms to locate information on the topic and gather relevant information
from various print and digital sources.

679041747EE1403896B48AAB07F9A9F4.description: Construct and formulate questions about a topic.

E79111656D29481FACE52A820099B049.description:
The student will conduct research and read a series of conceptually related texts on
selected topics to build knowledge on grade-four content and texts, solve problems, and
support cross-curricular learning.

D46BE21E8DC0421A961E7B4E7349B4C8.description:
Compare and contrast how ideas and topics are depicted (e.g., animation, famous images
and words, music and sound, photo-editing) in a variety of media and formats.

D7A82106B87746879B683052C1F7EDE1.description:
Differentiate between auditory, visual, and written media messages (e.g., videos, podcasts,
print advertisements) and their purposes (to explain, to inform, to persuade).

A863AA9C5D26491494B31BA6932B4904.description:
Strategically use two or more interdependent modes of communication to convey the
intended message and enhance the development of main ideas or themes.

3EB347E3971F4997A8E527CD4D78D586.description:
Select, organize, and create engaging presentations that include multimedia components
and visual displays.

F69A03589FB14F9B8A45FA911D477154.description:
Encouraging audience participation through planned interactions (e.g., questioning,
discussion, gathered responses, and movement).

28EDA89F67FE49A09A39F751DBEB17A6.description:
Using language (formal or informal) and style as appropriate to the audience, topic,
or purpose.

6B919EDEB8494ABDBAD82C4D7B493806.description: Speaking audibly with appropriate pacing, prosody, and voice level.

7388564316F84B39A87112F7A6BB8E82.description: Using descriptive details and appropriate facts to support themes or central ideas.

8C562BC61C2A462394DB169D8EBCA8D1.description:
Report orally on a topic or text, tell a story, or recount an experience in an organized
manner. This includes:

661B35DBC454477D9B3D7D3653B50D85.description: Using evidence, examples, or details to support opinions and conclusions.

D7641A80D7814A879F539A06E06E9197.description:
Asking and answering specific questions to clarify concepts, share, or follow up on
information, make connections, and confirm new understanding(s).

AD65EC801A2A47428D1D70DEE9978027.description: Respectfully building on others’ ideas and clearly expressing their own.

E2CD1416E2E04104A9BC6791BCB1C110.description: Listening actively and speaking using agreed-upon discussion rules.

5A626043AD4448648B39A6629881912D.description:
Participate in a range of sustained collaborative discussions with diverse partners on grade
four topics and texts. This includes:

AA16501C7CCD4766B80193F531992F3B.description:
The student will develop effective oral communication and collaboration skills to build a
community of learners that process, understand, and interpret content together.

3E6564680F034AFC860EC19C78910243.description: Consult reference materials to check and correct spelling.

63A03736C7F543A0A1E6566E45BDBA7A.description:
Use conventional spelling for high-frequency and other studied words and grade level word
analysis knowledge.

0809E7390D8746EE8F6C436F058E9A81.description: Use apostrophes to form contractions and to show possession in writing.

C0ACEBAB399E48CB9DE799F88D83B981.description: Use commas and quotation marks to indicate dialogue in writing.

9398DC430C0149C480A4A21DEC20D7DA.description: Use commas in series, dates, addresses, and letters in writing.

B47A7824AEE24D788B8CB0541A306C7D.description: Use standard noun-pronoun agreement when speaking and writing.

D7CF784858F94DB79F2F2D623F8146DF.description: Use standard subject-verb agreement when speaking and writing.

74F79DAC67C742958E06D8A1EB5C71D2.description:
Use modal words (e.g., can, may, must) to convey various conditions when speaking and
writing.

EE47FBD534D14C44906FD073684550AC.description:
Use adjectives to compare and describe noun or noun phrases with specificity when
speaking and writing.

304AE1A0D3FD4CB0AF847C7D38C727B7.description:
Use coordinating (e.g., and, but), subordinating (e.g., although, because) conjunctions to
join words and phrases in a sentence.

D8A4A7AA840042ABBF07C10193021B8C.description:
Produce, expand, and rearrange simple and compound sentences, including prepositional
phrases, when speaking and writing.

D94D81592C7D4B80889CFB9F752AAAB2.description:
The student will use the conventions of Standard English when speaking and writing,
differentiating between contexts that call for formal English and situations where informal
discourse is more appropriate.

2E548BA5BD1B40E2A5F8C19426894031.description:
Self-and peer-edit the writing for capitalization, spelling, punctuation, sentence structure,
paragraphing, and Standard English (See Language Usage for grade level expectations).

56470963287947B68799300807E8F77A.description:
With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as
needed by revising for quality of ideas, organization, sentence fluency, and word choice.

EA5D61CB643348FAB5BCB14ADF4D8297.description: Providing a concluding statement or section.

BB9382C9A43D41F09C8C33712AC9FF0E.description:
Using transition words and prepositional phrases to vary sentence structure and link
sentences.

ECC85D05DE0045AAB1E8DE088725DD2A.description:
Developing, selecting, and organizing ideas relevant to the topic, purpose, and genre
using precise language and topic-specific words and phrases, descriptive details, and
sensory language.

588EEDE36F6B4F89A8149B2D44E7D940.description:
Providing an introduction that includes a clear topic sentence that connects to the
central idea.

D28BA5903EFE4AC5AC5FE50D3DB5544D.description: Engage in writing as a process to compose well-developed paragraphs. This includes:

3FC60B53644A4BFEA632F607294AD00F.description:
Write in response to text(s) read (including summaries, reflections and descriptions) to
demonstrate thinking with details, examples, and other evidence from the text, using
linking words to connect ideas.

C5EBDA9CB9224EA4B0DA96C1F4D8B65A.description:
Write persuasive pieces on topics or texts that express a clear opinion supported by facts,
details, and reasons.

48627D8ABAB94D11BB6E82625FC8E6AB.description:
Write expository texts to examine a topic that develops the focus with facts, details, or
other information and uses linking words to connect ideas.

3E47A812698844EEB2EA95A55EE66FA6.description:
Write personal or fictional narratives that are logically organized around a central problem
or experience.

0B0CA0EF993F4ED586D7DE23292BA488.description:
Recognize different forms of writing (narrative, expository, and persuasive) have
distinctive patterns of organization to support their purpose.

C66A0D0F80DD4023893738B6C9771775.description:
The student will compose various works for diverse audiences and purposes, linked to
grade four content and texts.

E412286B153F42458698D7F8772B17AC.description:
Use phoneme/grapheme (sound/symbol) correspondences to decode (read) and encode
(spell) grade-level high-frequency words with automaticity and accuracy.

99F5BF82690B4957B9D82E3F8CB41096.description:
Use combined knowledge of all letter-sound correspondences, syllabication patterns, and
morphology (e.g., roots and affixes) to spell accurately.

B009B0E9F3F64DB9AE6F886D43DD09B8.description: Sign his/her first and last name.

686081551A9B45AFBD0327114C2D06A7.description:
The student will print legibly in manuscript and cursive while applying grade level
word knowledge to spell words correctly.

243E2F55911E4D9EB9DFB05DC3E6D91C.description:
Describe the relationships between a series of historical events, scientific concepts, or steps
in technical procedures using words that pertain to comparison, sequence, or cause and
effect.

5AA5CAEBFA1D466487D7BC79B749B809.description:
Compare and contrast multiple accounts of the same event or topic and describe the
differences in focus and the information provided.

7AC01AEB16A14585BFAC4E07D0C43CD4.description: Use prior (experience) and background (content) knowledge as context for new learning.

0999C84D15C848CDAF36E751B6E6CB81.description:
Explain the author’s purpose for writing, including what the author wants to answer,
explain, or describe based on the connections between particular sentences and paragraphs.

0466418B646A4DD7B54D75A22E2EF367.description:
Apply knowledge of text features and search tools in multiple print and digital sources to
locate and categorize information efficiently and gain meaning.

34D675BD8D7148D892740D8D51563BBF.description:
Explain how authors select an organizational pattern (e.g., cause/effect,
comparison/contrast, problem/solution) using transitional words and phrases to support
their purpose and a reader’s understanding of the text.

E1FE5ECB752A4AEFA7ABBD312050D3C6.description:
Distinguish between fact and opinion and explain how an author uses reasons and evidence
to support opinions within texts.

0DA70F19A64647F7938B4810E993CC5D.description:
Summarize events, procedures, ideas, or concepts in historical, scientific, or technical texts,
including what happened and why.

7BAAC4591057412E9753481804E81F85.description:
Summarize the main idea of multi-paragraph texts and the specific paragraphs within them,
explaining how key details support the main ideas.

9767EC1EC3DA49B182C1DF0D94A413A3.description:
The student will use textual evidence to demonstrate comprehension and build
knowledge from grade-level complex informational texts read.

9EF06054DF3A42708AC6C461CDB5C56B.description:
Explain the overall structure of stories, poems, and plays and how each successive part
builds on earlier sections.

3A01E505B7E6461E845B1D279E9AF348.description:
Compare and contrast details in paired literary and informational nonfiction texts including
their treatment of similar themes, topics, and patterns of events.

6050F7FC71A447D8ABAE96EB34AFA02C.description:
Set a purpose for reading by activating prior (experience) and background (content)
knowledge.

40E2479B4A6447E0AC9B0292B1397EF7.description: Differentiate between first-and third-person point of view.

F319CC5F4D9E4D32A2587F775820B46F.description: Identify the narrator of a story and the speaker of a poem.

EABA62B5AC184270BCE75B7043E0CEE0.description:
Identify the characteristics of different genres of literary texts (e.g., drama, poems, stories)
and refer to the structural elements of each.

2B80B27CA1F04B37ADC8F9978F1FF4D2.description:
Determine how an author uses language (dialogue, sensory language, and dialect),
characters, and settings to advance the plot.

9F4DA6EA304E44A58B4A41A8FAE45E85.description:
Analyze characters in-depth, drawing on specific details from the text, including their
words, actions, or a character’s thoughts.

19F5E79D152B44D0AD916C09A010B24E.description:
Describe the central conflict and explain the resolution using an understanding of text
structure and events from the plot as evidence.

DB8AEC1B90884AEDBC5FEACC06AAF1BC.description:
Summarize the theme of stories, dramas, or poetry, including the thematic topic (e.g.,
courage, loyalty, family) and how characters respond to challenges.

7B3B0DCC30444CF5BA72564A4A48654E.description:
The student will use textual evidence to demonstrate comprehension and build
knowledge from a variety of grade-level complex literary texts read to include fantasy,
humor, poetry, realistic fiction, historical fiction, biography, autobiography, and folklore/tall
tales, with a focus on poetry, realistic fiction and historical fiction.

76ABDB5AD79646DBAD4EF53ABB8598B1.description: Use newly learned words and phrases in discussions and speaking activities.

A61179DE4DC34EB3AEBB451502E0E716.description:
Use glossaries,beginning dictionaries, and thesauruses, both print and digital, to determine
or clarify the meaning of words and phrases.

AE034D23850D46D09BAB56A5B4772092.description: Use strategies to infer word meanings.

C55B35DEACA84714BDDAD4611E786E49.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs and adjectives.

D150E002566F44B5A877A9CEFDCA23C0.description:
Develop breadth of vocabulary knowledge by listening to and reading high quality,
complex text.

902D485A0A75460AA681D2301D508B20.description:
Apply knowledge of morphology, synonyms, and antonyms to determine the meaning of
complex words.

F0B51A75B1EC4E1394260AC9F602F205.description: Use the context of a sentence to apply knowledge of homophones.

B585DD65428044C68A29D6A5BF725E74.description:
Determine the meaning of complex words using frequently occurring root words and
inflectional affixes (e.g. -s, -ing, -ed).

BA1C4450D77F49AF8F01B676E2890965.description:
Discuss meanings of complex words and phrases acquired through conversations and
literature.

ABB92F231F7541D0B8896F48A1FA12ED.description:
Develop general academic language and content specific vocabulary by listening to,
reading, and discussing a variety of texts relevant to a grade four topic or subject area.

CE661939CC8F4338975289AB4360B1AE.description: The student will systematically build vocabulary and word knowledge based on gradefour content and texts.

CBD6ABC6FBAB496CA16B528D5871F121.description:
Use reading strategies as needed to aid and monitor comprehension when encountering
challenging sections of text. These sense-making strategies attend to common
organizational text structures, summarizing, asking questions of the text, and others
(Reading Strategies 3-12).

83CB247ECFA448078961CCA528FDA48B.description:
Regularly engage in reading a series of conceptually related texts organized around topics
of study to build knowledge and vocabulary (These texts should be at a range of
complexity levels so students can read the texts independently, with peers, or with modest
support.). Use this background knowledge as context for new learning (Deep Reading on
Topics to Build Knowledge and Vocabulary K-12).

6BA8963051384574BD40DC5731B4EFF0.description:
When responding to texts through discussion and/or writing, draw several pieces of
evidence from grade-level complex texts to support claims, conclusions, and inferences,
including quoting or paraphrasing from texts accurately and tracing where relevant
evidence is located (Textual Evidence, K-12).

E4BE92F1D6AE49708F8BB3296B87D7F2.description:
Proficiently read and comprehend a variety of literary and informational texts that exhibit
complexity at the lower range of the grades 4-5 band (See the Quantitative and Qualitative
Analysis charts for determining complexity in the Appendix.) (Text Complexity, 2-12).

9DDB35F7F6A94FF58A5F6C7C29067688.description:
Read a variety of grade-level complex texts with accuracy, automaticity, appropriate rate,
and meaningful expression in successive readings to support comprehension. Monitor
while reading to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, as necessary
(Reading Fluency, K-12).

BDB4F24103B54CE6B12A7C78D618FAF5.description:
The student will build knowledge and comprehension skills from reading a range of
challenging, content-rich texts. This includes fluently reading and gathering evidence from
grade-level complex texts, reading widely on topics to gain purposeful knowledge and
vocabulary, and using reading strategies when comprehension breaks down.

0900D3237BC64D46BC96C4D117D422AB.description: Developing Skilled Readers and Building Reading Stamina

1AC62FC15F6148BAA168028F28C1124F.description:
Read grade-level high-frequency words, including decodable and irregular words, with
automaticity and accuracy.

1A3812ABA5DC4E9AAF672826F5E53FCC.description: Use knowledge of morphology (suffixes, prefixes, root/base) to decode words.

4DD81A8F4381407B882DBC56C534E729.description: Use knowledge of syllabication and syllable types to decode and encode words.

68A9F8ABA8174FE6A0B3F79E31585ABC.description:
Phonics and Word Analysis: The student will apply grade level phonics and word
analysis skills to decode (read) unfamiliar words in grade level text.

3783093CCB064CA3A468A3842095D7EB.description:
See Kindergarten through grade two for standards that address Phonological and
Phonemic Awareness.

60281E4EDCD74CC38024CF60F5EB826A.description: See Kindergarten for standards that address Print Concepts.
